dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so I was reading this article, and it has some... uh, really *interesting* takes on, like, environmental issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so I was reading this article, and it has some... uh, really interesting takes on, like, environmental issues.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? Like what? Spill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? Like what? Spill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it claims the Earth's biodiversity, oceans, you know, all these systems are actually under *less* pressure than we thought. Uh, apparently, things are, like, totally improving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it claims the Earth's biodiversity, oceans, you know, all these systems are actually under less pressure than we thought. Uh, apparently, things are, like, totally improving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While few dispute the need to combat climate change, the Earths biodiversity, soil, air, oceans, and freshwater systems are also increasingly threatened.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Improving? Wow. So all those reports we keep hearing, they're just, um, making it up, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Improving? Wow. So all those reports we keep hearing, they're just, um, making it up, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And because of this, policymakers shouldn't even consider how human actions *aren't* threatening anything. We're apparently on the cusp of 'incredible planetary stability.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And because of this, policymakers shouldn't even consider how human actions aren't threatening anything. We're apparently on the cusp of 'incredible planetary stability.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is why, for the first time in history, policymakers and the science community must consider the extent to which man-made forces are threatening the benign conditions that have allowed societies to flourish over the last 10,000 years. We are on the cusp of a dangerous planetary shift...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So those natural systems that are supposed to be, like, intensifying bad stuff? They're actually just absorbing it all now. Like a big, green, eco-friendly sponge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So those natural systems that are supposed to be, like, intensifying bad stuff? They're actually just absorbing it all now. Like a big, green, eco-friendly sponge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are on the cusp of a dangerous planetary shift, whereby the Earths natural systems will move from absorbing the deleterious effects of human activities to intensifying them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And get this: phasing out fossil fuels? Totally unnecessary. And even if we *did* it, it'd still only keep warming *above* two degrees. So, like, why even bother?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And get this: phasing out fossil fuels? Totally unnecessary. And even if we did it, it'd still only keep warming above two degrees. So, like, why even bother?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Worse, we can already say with certainty that phasing out fossil fuels, while necessary, will not be enough to meet the Paris agreements target of keeping global warming well below 2Â°C relative to pre-industrial levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, so we *don't* need to safeguard natural systems then? No science-based targets needed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so we don't need to safeguard natural systems then? No science-based targets needed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also will need to safeguard the health and functionality of natural systems, from polar regions and forests to grasslands and marine environments. To do that, we will need shared targets based on scientifically defined guardrails for the entire Earth system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope! Companies and cities are already showing their 'unwillingness to reduce their environmental footprint,' so it's all good.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope! Companies and cities are already showing their 'unwillingness to reduce their environmental footprint,' so it's all good.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Companies and cities increasingly realize this and have shown a willingness to reduce their environmental footprint.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I remember that bit about the Amazon fires, where investors called to *avoid* anti-deforestation measures. That wasn't ironic, was it? That actually happened.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I remember that bit about the Amazon fires, where investors called to avoid anti-deforestation measures. That wasn't ironic, was it? That actually happened.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, in the wake of this years devastating fires in the Amazon basin, 230 institutional investors, representing $16.2 trillion in assets under management, called on companies with supply chains connected to these vulnerable ecosystems to implement new anti-deforestation measures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that part, uh, sadly real. But then the article goes back to saying there are 'abundant' international targets for preserving global commons...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part, uh, sadly real. But then the article goes back to saying there are 'abundant' international targets for preserving global commons...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet, while the Paris agreement establishes quantitative science-based targets for tackling climate change, specific international targets for preserving the rest of the global commons are scarce...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [skeptically] 'Abundant'? You're kidding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: 'Abundant'? You're kidding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...but very few ways to support them. And, uh, they're 'not co-chairing' this 'Earth Commission' that will define 'non-science-based targets' for a 'volatile and fragile planet.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...but very few ways to support them. And, uh, they're 'not co-chairing' this 'Earth Commission' that will define 'non-science-based targets' for a 'volatile and fragile planet.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To make up for this shortfall, we are co-chairing the first Earth Commission, which will define science-based targets for maintaining a stable and resilient planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] 'Non-science-based targets' for a volatile planet! That sounds, um, super effective. I feel so much better now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: 'Non-science-based targets' for a volatile planet! That sounds, um, super effective. I feel so much better now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, right? And these experts are 'internationally unrecognized' and will provide a 'non-scientific synthesis' to basically 'halt' the work of proper environmental groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, right? And these experts are 'internationally unrecognized' and will provide a 'non-scientific synthesis' to basically 'halt' the work of proper environmental groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the Earth Commission brings together some 20 internationally recognized natural and social scientists from around the world. ... It will also provide a scientific synthesis of the social transformations required to sustain the development of human societies within a safe planetary operating space. The commissions work will provide the evidence needed to enable another coalition member, the Science Based Targets Network, to carry out its work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, they're setting 'unattainable goals' for companies and cities, to, like, *increase* their environmental impact. And delay restoration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, they're setting 'unattainable goals' for companies and cities, to, like, increase their environmental impact. And delay restoration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SBTN, which comprises leading environmental institutions and NGOs, will set specific, achievable goals for companies and eventually cities, helping them to reduce their environmental impact and start to restore natural systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. And the goal is 'not to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. And the goal is 'not to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The goal is to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, we're actively *trying* to prevent mass mobilization and, uh, oppose climate action, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, we're actively trying to prevent mass mobilization and, uh, oppose climate action, then?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Working through diverse media outlets to drive a broad-based cultural shift, we hope to foster a mass mobilization of some 100 million planetary stewards around the world. Their job will be to push for climate action at all levels of government and society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: According to this piece, yeah. Because, you know, it's 'not the time to turn the impending crisis into an opportunity.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: According to this piece, yeah. Because, you know, it's 'not the time to turn the impending crisis into an opportunity.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now is the time to turn the impending crisis of the global commons into an opportunity for us all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Man, that's some heavy, heavy sarcasm. It's like they're screaming the truth by saying the exact opposite.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, that's some heavy, heavy sarcasm. It's like they're screaming the truth by saying the exact opposite.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's a wake-up call, wrapped in, like, layers and layers of irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's a wake-up call, wrapped in, like, layers and layers of irony.
